stanza.line: My glass shall not persuade me I am (a)old(/a)
So long as youth and thou are of one (b)date(/b)
But when in thee time's furrows I (a)behold(/a)
Then look I death my days should (b)expiate(/b)
For all that beauty that doth cover (c)thee(/c)
Is but the seemly raiment of my (d)heart(/d)
Which in thy breast doth live as thine in (c)me(/c)
How can I then be elder than thou (d)art(/d)
O therefore love be of thyself so (e)wary(/e)
As I not for my self but for thee (f)will(/f)
Bearing thy heart which I will keep so (e)chary(/e)
As tender nurse her babe from faring (f)ill(/f)
Presume not on thy heart when mine is (g)slain(/g)
Thou gav'st me thine not to give back (g)again(/g)
